author: Special Correspondent
text:
Thieves broke open the house of a retired staff of the Tamil Nadu Generation and Distribution Corporation (TANGEDCO) and decamped with 19 sovereigns of gold jewellery and Rs 25,000 cash.

Police said G Nageswari (60), the retired staff, who was living alone in the house at Adam Nagar, near here, had gone to her mother’s place in Thirupullani on February 20 after locking the house, after which, the burglary took place.

It came to light when the aged widow returned home on Wednesday afternoon. The thieves who gained entry into the house by breaking open the lock at the front door, police said. After breaking open the two steel bureaus, they decamped with the jewellery and cash, police said.

Superintendent of Police N. Manivannan, who visited the house, suspected hands of local offenders and exuded confidence of cracking the case at the earliest. Police pressed into service sniffer dogs and finger print experts. The experts have lifted some finger prints from the scene.
title: House burgled in Ramnad
